Settings یہ ایک سوال ہے ؟ Q. WFA101 Sync Data Download Data
Section A: Identification Information (HH): Section A: Identification Information (HH) Date of interview Time of Interview Hours Minutes Code of Interviewer Name of Interviewer Name of District Peshawar Lakki Marwat Quetta Union Council Block, Street, Colony, Village Name Cluster Number Household number Complete Address including landmark Before progressing, take consent; did you get permission? If permission was not granted, stop interviewing and proceed to the next household. Yes, permission is granted No, permission is denied Name of respondent Age of respondent (In Years) (Minimum age: 18 years) Gender of respondent Male Female Literacy level of respondent: Now I would like you to read this sentence to me. SHOW CARD TO RESPONDENT If respondent cannot read whole sentence, PROBE: Can you read any part of the sentence to me? Cannot Read at All Able to Read Only Part of The Sentence Able to Read Whole Sentence No Card With required language Blind/Visually Impaired Qualification of respondent Mention completed years of education; Code: 55 for uneducated, 17 for Professional and 22 for only religious studies Profession of Respondent (Use Below Codes) Professional/technical/managerial Clerical Business Sales and services Skilled manual Unskilled manual Domestic service Agriculture Student Unemployed Homemaker Retired Housewife Others Please Specify Is respondent the head of household? Yes, Head of household No, Other Member Name of Head of Household Profession of head of household (Use Below codes) Professional/technical/managerial Clerical Business Sales and services Skilled manual Unskilled manual Domestic service Agriculture Student Unemployed Homemaker Retired Housewife Others Please Specify Total members Male members including male children of all ages Female members including female children of all ages Number of under-five children - Male Number of under-five children - Female Result of Interview Completed Partially completed Refused No eligible respondent available Locked Household not found Other specify Line no Name Gender Male Female Date of Birth Days Months Year Age Year Months Relationship with respondent Mother Father Primary Caretaker (not parents) Other childInformation member Name of Mother Age Education Profession Mother is Available? Yes No Name of father Education Profession Birth weight (kg) Was this birth registered? If yes with? Not registered NADRA LHW Child’s Line No Name of Child Has the child had diarrhea in the last two weeks? Yes No How much was given to drink to the child during the diarrhoea episode? Much Less Somewhat Less About The Same More Nothing To Drink Don\'t Know How much was given to eat to the child during the diarrhoea episode? Much Less Somewhat Less About The Same More Never Gave Food Don\'t Know Did you seek advice or treatment for the diarrhoea from any source? Yes No Where did you seek advice or treatment for diarrhoea? Public Sector Govt. Hospital RHC/MCH BHU Lady Health Worker Hospital/Clinic Other Public Sector Private Sector Medical Store Pvt. Doctor Homeopath Dispenser / Compounder Hakim Dai, TBA CMW Other Private What Was Given to Treat Diarrhea? ORS Antibiotic Antimotility (anti-diarrhoea) Zinc Unknown pill or syrup Antibiotic Non-antibiotic Unknown injection Intravenous (iv) Home remedy /herbal medicine Others Please Specify Why did you not seek treatment? Fear of COVID-19 Confidence that child will get better himself Someone you knew advised treatment ChildInformation knew management themselves Financial reasons Limitations of transport Others Please Specify Was the child given ORS? Yes No Was the child given Zinc supplements? Yes No Has the child been sick with cough in the past two weeks? Yes No Has the child been sick with fever in the past two weeks? Yes No Has (NAME) had fast, short, rapid breaths or difficulty breathing at any time in the last 2 weeks? Yes No Was the fast or difficult breathing due to a problem in the chest or to a blocked or runny nose? Chest only Nose only Both Others Please Specify Did you seek treatment from any source? Yes No Where did you seek advice or treatment for cough, fever or difficulty breathing? Govt. Hospital RHC/MCH BHU Lady Health Worker Other Public Sector Private Sector Hospital/Clinic Medical Store Pvt. Doctor Homeopath Dispenser / Compounder Hakim Dai, TBA CMW Other Private What Was Given to Treat cough, fever or difficulty breathing? antibiotic unknown pill or syrup antibiotic non-antibiotic unknown injection Intravenous (iv) Home remedy/herbal medicine Others Please Specify Why did you not seek treatment? Fear of COVID-19 Confidence that child will get better himself Someone you knew advised treatment ChildInformation knew management themselves Financial reasons Limitations of transport Others Please Specify Section IM: Child Immunization INSTRUCTION Complete Section IM for all children in household 35 months and under (if more than one child, then use another sheet) Did you ever have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider where (name)’s vaccinations are written down? Yes No If yes: may I see it please? The respondent should already have brought the card when you got permission to begin the interview. Seen Not seen If not, why you didn’t receive any vaccination card? Don’t think it’s important Never visited a facility Could not visit a facility because of COVID-19 Card was not available with the health provider The vaccinator/ facility didn’t provide the card Not aware of such cards Other specify Check and copy Date of Birth recorded on card: Day Month Year INSTRUCTION Please record the date of immunization for each antigen from the card 1. If the date is recorded but not readable, record 44 in day column 2. If the date is not recorded but a tick () mark is present, record 88 in day column 3. If neither date is recorded nor a tick () mark is present, prompt the mother for each such antigen and record 66 if she confirms the receipt of respective antigen by recall otherwise record 97. At Birth -BCG Day Month Year Polio (at birth) (OPV 0) Day Month Year Polio (OPV1) Day Month Year Pentavalent1 (DPTHibHepB) (Penta1) Day Month Year Pneumococcal 1 (Conjugate) (PCV1) Day Month Year Rotavirus vaccine1 (RV1) Day Month Year Polio (OPV2) Day Month Year Pentavalent2 (DPTHibHepB) (Penta 2) Day Month Year Pneumococcal2 (Conjugate) (PCV2) Day Month Year Rotavirus vaccine2 (RV2) Day Month Year Polio (OPV3) Day Month Year Pentavalent3 (DPTHibHepB) (Penta 3) Day Month Year Pneumococcal3 (Conjugate) (PCV3) Day Month Year Polio (IPV) Day Month Year Measles-1 Day Month Year Measles-2 Day Month Year Check IM0501-IM0516: Are all vaccines (BCG to Measles-2) recorded? Yes No Has (name) ever received any vaccinations to prevent (him/her) from getting diseases, including vaccinations received in a campaign, immunization day or child health day? Yes Did (name) receive polio drops during the last campaign Yes No Dont know No Dont Know How many times has (name) polio drops been given during the national polio campaigns? . Has (name) ever received a BCG vaccination against tuberculosis – that is, an injection in the arm or shoulder that usually causes a scar? Yes No Dont know . Has (name) ever received any vaccination drops in the mouth to protect (him/her) from polio? Probe by indicating that the first drop is usually given at birth and later at the same time as injections to prevent other diseases. Yes No Dont know Were the first polio drops received in the first two weeks after birth? Yes No Dont know How many times were the polio drops received at Govt or Private Health Facility or from Govt Outreach services? Number of times Number of times How many times was Polio vaccine received during a large campaign? Number of times Don\'t know Don\'t Know The last time (name) received the polio drops, did (he/she) also get an injection to protect against polio? Probe to ensure that both were given, drops and injection Yes No Dont know Has (name) ever received a Pentavalent vaccination – that is, an injection in the thigh to prevent (him/her) from getting tetanus, whooping cough, diphtheria, Hepatitis B disease, and Haemophilus influenza type B? Probe by indicating that Pentavalent vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Polio drops Yes No Dont know How many times was the Pentavalent vaccine received? Number of times Number of times Don\'t know Has (name) ever received a Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination – that is, an injection to prevent (him/her) from getting pneumococcal disease, including ear infections and meningitis caused by pneumococcus? Probe by indicating that Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Pentavalent vaccination. Yes No Dont know How many times was the pneumococcal vaccine received? Number of times Number of times Don\'t know Has (name) ever received drops for Rotavirus vaccine (RV) vaccination- A vaccine given orally soon after 6 weeks birth to protect against rotavirus infections, which are the leading cause of severe diarrhea among young children. Yes No Dont know How many times were the drops received? Number of times Number of times Don\'t know Has (name) ever received an inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) – that is, a shot in the thigh at the age of 14 weeks or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting polio? Yes No Dont know Has (name) ever received a Measles Injection – that is, a shot in the arm at the age of 9 months or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting measles? Yes No Dont know How many times was a Measles Injection vaccine received? Number of times Number of times Don\'t know Where from (name) is usually vaccinated? If the child is vaccinated from multiple sources, mention the usual source with higher frequency of vaccine doses. Can you please specify where is this facility located? Within Catchment area 10km Within District/ city Out of District/city Other Specify Govt. Health facility What is the time taken to reach this facility where vaccination was received? Hours Minutes Private health facility Government outreach service
Other (specify) Why (name) is not vaccinated? If the child has not received all their vaccinations, ask the mother/caretaker Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons. Place of immunization too far Observe BCG Scar Scar Present Scar Absent Child Not Available Not Observed Time of immunization not convenient Mother too busy ChildInformation problem including mother ill Child ill, not brought Child ill, brought but not vaccinated Long wait Rumors No faith in immunization Fear of side reaction Time or Place of immunization not Known Took child but no vaccine available Took child but no vaccinator Took child facility closed Child was sick Took child but not vaccination day COVID-19-related (fear of going out, sickness in childInformation) Don’t Know Others Please Specify Section PD: Care seeking during pregnancy and delivery (To be administered to the mother of the youngest under-five child in the household) Child’s Line Number (youngest under 5) WRA’s Name When was your last pregnancy? 0-5.9 months back 6-11.9 months back 12-23.9 months back 24 months back or longer Did you seek antenatal care during your last pregnancy? Yes No Don’t know From whom did you seek antenatal care? HEALTH PERSONNEL Doctor Nurse Midwife LHV OTHER PERSON Dai-TBA Lady Health Worker Homeopath Hakim Dispenser/Compounder Others Please Specify Where did you seek antenatal care? Home Respondent’s home Other home Public medical sector Government hospital Government clinic Mother & child health centre Other public Please Specify Private medical sector Private hospital Private clinic Private maternity home Other private Please Specify How many times did you receive antenatal care during last pregnancy? Probe to identify the number of times antenatal care was received. If a range is given, record the minimum number of times antenatal care received. Number of times Don’t Know Why did you not seek antenatal care? Fear of COVID-19 Assumption that care is not needed during pregnancy On the advice of a relative or friend ChildInformation knew how to care for you themselves Financial reasons Limitations of transport Have you ever taken any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant? Yes No How often did you take IFA during pregnancy? Daily Once a week Biweekly Monthly Rarely How many months or days did you take IFA? Months Days Who conducted the delivery? HEALTH PERSONNEL Doctor Nurse Midwife LHV سی ایم ڈبلیو OTHER PERSON Dai-TBA Lady Health Worker Others Please Specify During you last birth, where was the baby born? Own home Other home Government Hospital RHC BHU birth station Other Public Facility Please Specify Private Hospital/Clinic Other Private Facility Specify If at home, why was the delivery not in a facility? Fear of COVID-19 All my deliveries have been at home My childInformation did not want me to go to a facility Financial reasons Limitations of transport Others Please Specify Did anyone check on your health after delivery? Yes No Who checked your health after delivery? [MULTIPLE RESPONSES] Gynaecologist Other doctor Nurse CMW LHW LHV TBA Others Please Specify How long after delivery did the first of these checks happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. OTHERWISE, RECORD WEEKS. Hours Days Weeks Don’t know/ don’t remember How many times such check happen? Times Did anyone check on (name of child) health? Yes No Don’t know Who checked the child’s health after delivery? [Multiple responses] Paediatrician Other doctor Nurse CMW LHW LHV TBA Others Please Specify How long after delivery did the first of these checks happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. Otherwise, record weeks. Hours Days Weeks Don’t know/ don’t remember How many times such check happen? Times Section BF: Breastfeeding, Health & Care-seeking Behaviors Instruction: To be administered to the mother of the youngest child in the household, between 0-23 months of age Child’s Line Number (youngest under 2) WRA’s Name What is (NAME) birthday? Year Month Date Has (NAME) ever been breastfed? Yes No Don’t know How long after birth did you first put (NAME) to the breast? Immediately Hours Days Never Did you feed first milk (colostrum) to the child? Yes No Don’t know Why did you not feed colostrum to (NAME)? Bad milk Harmful for child Thickness Others Please Specify Was (NAME) given anything to drink before breast milk? Yes No Don’t know What was (NAME) given to drink? Milk (other than breast milk) Plain water Sugar or glucose water Gripe water Sugar-salt-water solution Fruit juice Infant formula Tea / Infusions / Traditional herbal preparations Honey Prescribed medicine Not given anything to drink Others Please Specify Was (NAME) breastfed yesterday during the day or at night? Yes No Don’t know Sometimes babies are fed breast milk in different ways, for example by spoon, cup, or bottle. This can happen when the mother cannot always be with her baby. Sometimes babies are breastfed by another woman, or given breast milk from another woman by spoon, cup or bottle or some other way. This can happen if a mother cannot breastfeed her own baby. Did (NAME) consume breast milk in any of these ways yesterday during the day or at night? Yes No Don’t know Now I would like to ask you about some medicines and vitamins that are sometimes given to infants. Was (NAME) given any vitamin drops or other medicines as drops yesterday during the day or at night? Yes No Don’t know Was (NAME) given ORS/NIMKOL yesterday during the day or at night? Yes No Don’t know Section G5: COVID (To be administered to the mother of the youngest under-five child in the household) Have you heard of COVID-19? Yes No Don’t know How concerned are you about COVID-19? Not Worried A Little Worried Somewhat Worried Very Worried Extremely Worried Do you think COVID-19 exists? Yes, it exists No, it doesn’t Don’t know How deadly do you think COVID-19 is? Not At All Deadly Not Very Deadly Not Deadly Somewhat Deadly Extremely Deadly Do you know which group of people are most at risk of COVID? Everyone Elderly Adults Children Pregnant/Lactating Women Health Workers Person With Pre-Existing Conditions Others Please Specify Who do you trust for information around COVID? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously) Community Leader Religious Leader Relatives Friends Health Worker At Health Facility Health Worker Via Door To Door Campaign Newspaper Radio Television Social Media Others Please Specify Will all people with COVID-19 show symptoms? Yes No Don’t know What symptoms are most commonly reported with COVID-19 (check all that apply) Fever Cough Flu Sore throat Chest congestion/Difficulty in breathing Losing sense of smell & taste Diarrhea Don’t know Others Please Specify What do you think are the different modes of transmission of COVID-19? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously) Touching surfaces contaminated with the virus Shaking hands Directly coming in contact with an infected person’s body fluids such as blood, vomit, or sweat Via droplets entering through mouth or nose when an infected person sneezes or coughs Unhygienic food preparation Radio waves such as mobile networks Mosquito bite Don’t know Others Please Specify What according to you are effective methods of preventing infection from COVID-19? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously) Frequently washing hands using soap and water for 20 seconds Cleaning hands with hand sanitizer Covering mouth and nose using a tissue or flexed elbow while coughing or sneezing Maintain social distancing Avoiding contact with sick people showing signs of COVID-19 Wearing a mask in public places Keep oneself isolated Praying to God Don’t know Others Please Specify Has COVID-19, the subsequent lockdown & restrictions and fear affected the nutrition and feeding of your child? Yes No How has it affected breastfeeding and/or feeding of the child? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously) I have reduced the frequency and amount I feed my child I have increased the frequency and amount I feed my child I cannot afford same food for child I cannot travel to markets to purchase food 4 The foods I feed my child are no longer available in the market Others Please Specify Has COVID-19, the subsequent lockdown & restrictions and fear disrupted your child’s immunization? Yes No Has your child (under-5) received oral polio vaccine in the past 10 months? Yes No Has your child received all vaccinations in the past 10 months that were due as per EPI schedule? Yes No If not, why was the child not taken for vaccination? Fear of COVID-19 Financial reasons Limitations of transport Vaccinations can be delayed Forgot that there was a vaccine due Interrupted services Others Please Specify Has the number of times you visit health facilities reduced during COVID-19? Yes No Why has it decreased? Fear of COVID-19 Financial reasons Limitations of transport Vaccinations can be delayed Forgot that there was a vaccine due Interrupted services Others Please Specify For what conditions have you decided to not go to the doctor? My child had diarrhea My child had fever or cough My/my wife’s pregnancy and/or childbirth My child’s health issue, prefer not specify My health, prefer not to specify Other, prefer not to say Others Please Specify Section SE: Household Characteristics What is the mother tongue of the head of the household? Urdu Punjabi Sindhi Pushtu Baluchi Siraiki Hindko Others Please Specify Main material of the dwelling floor Natural Floor Mud/Clay/Earth/Sand Dung Rudimentary/Floor Wood planks Palm/Bamboo Finished Floor Parquet or polished wood Vinyl or asphalt strips Ceramic tiles Cement Carpet Bricks Lime Others Please Specify What is the primary construction material used to build the house (by observation)? NATURAL WALLS No Walls Cane/Palm/Trunks Dirt Mud/Stones Bamboo/Sticks/Mud RUDIMENTARY WALLS Unbaked Bricks/Mud Bamboo With Mud Stone With Mud Uncovered Adobe Plywood Reused Wood FINISHED WALLS Cement Stone With Lime/Cement Bricks Cement Blocks Covered Adobe Wood Planks/Shingles Others Please Specify Observe the primary construction material Used to build the roof? NATURAL ROOFING No Roof Thatch/Palm Leaf Sod/Grass RUDIMENTARY ROOFING Rustic Mat Palm/Bamboo Wood Planks Cardboard FINISHED ROOFING Asbestos Reinforced Brick Cement/R Metal Wood Calamine/Cement Fiber Ceramic Tiles Cement/RCC Roofing Shingles Others Please Specify What is the ownership status of this house? Owned Rented Living without paying rent Others Please Specify If this house is rental, what is the monthly rent of this house? (Rupees) How many rooms in this HH are used for sleeping?(number) What is the main source of drinking water In this HH? PIPED WATER Piped Into Dwelling Piped To Yard/Plot Piped To Neighbor Public Tap/Standpipe Tube Well Or Borehole DUG WELL Protected Well Unprotected Well WATER FROM SPRING Protected Spring Unprotected Spring Rainwater Tanker Truck Cart With Small Tank Surface Water (River/Dam/ Lake/Pond/Stream/Canal/ Irrigation Channel) Bottled Water Others Please Specify Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink? Yes No Don’t know What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink? Anything else? RECORD ALL MENTIONED Boil Add Bleach/Chlorine Strain Through A Cloth Use Water Filter (Ceramic/ Sand/Composite/Etc) Solar Disinfection Let It Stand And Settle Don\'t Know Other Pleas Specify What kind of toilet facility do members of your HH usually use? FLUSH OR POUR FLUSH TOILET Flush To Piped Sewer System Flush To Septic Tank Flush To Pit Latrine Flush To Somewhere Else Flush, Don\'t Know Where PIT LATRINE Ventilated Improved Pit Latrine Pit Latrine With Slab Pit Latrine Without Slab/Open Pit Composting Toilet Bucket Toilet Hanging Toilet/Hanging Latrine No Facility/Bush/Field Others Please Specify What is the drainage system of this HH? (Through observation) Underground sewerage lines Open sewerage line Unattached sewerage lines Others Please Specify We would like to learn about the places that households use to wash their hands. Can you please show me where members of your household most often wash their hands? Observed, Fixed Place Observed, Mobile NOT OBSERVED Not in Dwelling/Yard/Plot Not Observed, No Permission to See Not Observed, Other Reason Observe presence of water at the place of washing RECORD OBSERVATION Water Is Available Water Is Not Available Observe presence of soap, detergent, or other cleansing agent at the place for handwashing. RECORD OBSERVATION Soap or Detergent (Bar, Liquid, Powder, Paste) Ash, Mud, Sand None Do you have any soap or detergent in your household for hand washing? Yes No If yes, can you please show it to me? [Multiple responses] Bar soap Detergent (powder/liquid/paste) Liquid soap Ash/mud/sand None In what situations do you wash your hands with soap? This is an open-ended question. Do not read the answer choices. Before preparing food Yes No Before eating Yes No Before feeding a child Yes No After handling feces/diapers Yes No After defecating or using the latrine Yes No Others Please Specify Yes No What fuel does your HH use for cooking? Electricity LPG Natural Gas Biogas Kerosene Coal, Lignite Charcoal Wood Straw/Shrubs/Grass Agricultural Crop Animal Dung No Food Cooked In Household Others Please Specify What transport does most of the childInformation members of this HH usually use? (select all that apply) Private car Company car Motorcycle Public transport By walk Cycle Others Please Specify What technique do you use to stop the breeding of flies and mosquitos? [Multiple responses] Spray Mat Mosquito net Globe Smoke Or frankincense Others Please Specify Does your household have Electricity YES NO Radio YES NO Television YES NO Non-Mobile Telephone YES NO Refrigerator YES NO Almirah/Cabinet YES NO Chair YES NO Room Cooler YES NO Air conditioner YES NO Washing Machine YES NO Water Pump YES NO Bed YES NO Clock YES NO Sofa YES NO Camera YES NO Sewing Machine YES NO Computer YES NO Internet Connection YES NO Does anyone in your household own a mobile phone? YES NO How many mobile phones are there in your household? How many of these are smartphones? How many of these smartphones are Android-based? Which mobile service provider is the Android-based smartphone connected to? [Multiple responses] Ufone Jazz Zong Telenor What connectivity speed does the Android-based smartphone have? [Multiple responses] 2G 3G 4G Does the caregiver of a young child in the household have access to the Android smartphone or not? Yes NO Who owns their own Android smart phone? [Multiple responses] Myself My mother-in-law/mother My husband/wife My father-in-law/father Children Others Please Specify Where do your childInformation members usually go to seek care? Govt. Health care facility Private health care facility Others Please Specify From whom do your childInformation members usually seek care? HEALTH PERSONNEL Doctor Nurse Midwife LHV OTHER PERSON Dai-TBA Lady Health Worker Homeopath Hakim Dispenser/Compounder How much time does it take to reach any govt or private health care facility near your house by walking? Hours Minutes For how long you had been living in this house? Months Years Do you have any plans to shift somewhere else next year? Yes No Don’t know Has your household or anyone in your household received financial assistance in last 12 months? Yes No Don’t know If yes, then please identify which program they are registered with? [Multiple Responses] Unconditional Cash Transfer Waseela-e-Haq Waseela-e-Taleem Waseela-e-Rozgar Waseela-e-Sehat Bait ul Mal EOBI BISP Workers Welfare Funds National Income Support Program Others Please Specify When was the last payment received from this program? In the last one month In the last 03 months In the last 06 months More than one year ago More than two years ago Don’t know Is a financial assistance program receipt available? Observed by surveyor. RECORD OBSERVATION Available and observed Not observed Have you or anyone in the household received a food supplement from an organization in the past 12 months? Yes No Don’t know Rupees Numbers of Rooms

Section 1 Identical Information: Identical Information AMANHI COVID - 19 Download Data Upload Data Email Password Login Sign in
CHECK PENDING FORMS OPEN NEW FORM Records Summary Main Menu ONLY FOR TESTING Database No Don’t Know No one Never Applicable /Not Available Not Applicable This password is too short This field is required This password is incorrect Not Available Refused Other Please explain Year Month Week Day Hour Minutes Kilograms Kilometers cm Inch Rupees Number Name Contact Number The name of head of the household corresponds to the line listing data. Name of new head of the household یہ فارم ہر ہفتے فون کے ذریعے/ ہوم وزٹ بھرا جائیں گا Study ID Study Site,Para Code,Block No,Structure,Family No INTERVIEWER NAME INTERVIEWER CODE DATE OF VISIT Study (Follow-up) Week (mandatory) AMANHI Woman ID (unique for every woman) Woman’s Pregnancy ID for the child (Mandatory) Child ID (Mandatory) Child’s date of birth Child’s age in months Month DK NA Child’s sex Male Female Woman Name Husband Name
Section 2. OUTCOME OF VISIT: OUTCOME OF VISIT Was the visit successful Yes NO If visit is not successful, what was the reason Died (Complete a censorship form21cm) Permanently moved (Complete a censorship form21cm) Withdrawal of participation (Complete a censorship form21cm) Could not be contacted despite trying 3 times Refused of this visit Not living with mother Other
Section.3 MORBIDITY HISTORY : MORBIDITY HISTORY Has your child had any illness since the last time we contacted or visited you? Yes No DK If yes, have you had any of the following symptoms since the last time we contacted you? (If it is the first interview, ask if women had any of the following symptoms in the past 7 days) NA Fever YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of fever (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Headache YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of headache (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Chills YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Chills (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Cough YES NO DK NA YES If yes, number of days of Cough (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Sore throat If yes, number of days of Sore throat (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA Sneezing YES YES NO NO DK DK NA NA If yes, number of days of Sneezing (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Runny/stuffy nose YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Runny/stuffy nose (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Fast breathing or difficulty breathing YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Fast breathing or difficulty breathing (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA Convulsions / fits YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Convulsions / fits (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA Jaundice YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Jaundice (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA Muscle aches YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Muscle aches (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Nausea/ vomiting YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Nausea/ vomiting (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Diarrhoea YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Diarrhoea (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Abdominal cramps or pain YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days ofAbdominal cramps or pain (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Anosmia (loss of smell) YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Anosmia (loss of smell) (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Loss of sense of taste/ageusia YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Loss of sense of taste/ageusia (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Delirium/confusion YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Delirium/confusion (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Hallucinations YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Hallucinations (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Skin rashes YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Skin rashes (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Dizziness or fainting YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Dizziness or fainting (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Body aches If yes, number of days of Body aches (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA YES NO DK NA Malaria (site specific) YES NO DK NA If yes, number of days of Malaria (site specific) (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Other symptoms1 YES NO DK NA Other1 (specify): If yes, number of days of Other symptoms1 (xx, 88=DK, 99=NA) Other symptoms2 YES NO DK NA Other 2 (specify): If yes for OTHER symptoms 2 number of days
Section 4 CARE SEEKING FOR ILLNESS: CARE SEEKING FOR ILLNESS Did any of these symptoms in your child require you to miss work Yes No DK NA Did you seek medical care for any of the above symptoms in your child since my last visit?
